bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John R. Taylor, July 2, 1942

div1.p: Hench returns films and photographs to Taylor. Hench comments on his upcoming military service.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John R. Taylor, July 2, 1942
div1.opener:
July 2, 1942
Mr. John R. Taylor
548 Grand Ave.
Upper Darby, Pennsylvania
My dear Mr. Taylor:
div1.p:
You will, I am afraid, think that I am very
tardy in returning your films and photographs. I have
had a very hectic four months and I am about to enter the
army. I have copied most of your pictures and I am de-
lighted to have them.

You speak of print No. 2 1/4. I can't find any
print so numbered but you have two prints No. 3. If I ever
get time I hope to send you a number of questions and I will
be delighted to have you answer them. I am afraid, however,
that my army work will keep me pretty occupied and that my
study of the story of yellow fever will have to be indefin-
itely postponed.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
95
